alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring, with numerous roads closed. Although the heaviest rain has ended, rivers and streams will continue to run high through this evening, continuing the threat of flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mooers, Altona, Ellenburg Depot, Dannemora, Lyon Mountain, Merrill, Ellenburg, Alder Bend, Ellenburg Mountain, Irona, Ellenburg Center, Miner Lake State Park, Chazy Lake, Cannon Corners and Mooers Forks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
